intro: Pedicularis verticillata var. hallaisanensis, commonly known as the Hallaisan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from the roots of host plants while also performing photosynthesis. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
